etymology.description: 银(銀) (yín, "silver") + 行(行) (háng, "business") = place for financial activities
etymology.interpretation: The word 銀行 (yínháng) literally means a place where transactions involving silver occur, reflecting the historical use of silver as currency. This makes sense as banks are institutions that manage currency and financial transactions.

examples.chinese: 我把钱存进了银行(我把錢存進了銀行)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ qián cún jìnle yínháng.
examples.english: I deposited money into the bank.

examples.chinese: 我需要取钱(我需要取錢)，所以去了银行(所以去了銀行)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xūyào qǔ qián, suǒyǐ qùle yínháng.
examples.english: I needed to withdraw money, so I went to the bank.
